page.title: 04THAKEHAM POST OFFICE
page.content: Part of the{Post Office}was built in 1658, the rest in 1805. The previous owner was Mr.Skinner, he owned it from 1925 until 1978.The well outside is 72 feet deep. Once a man broke into the {Post Office}and stole a bicycle and some money. The{Post Office}opens at 8.15 and closes at 5.30pm every day except Tuesday and Saturday when the shop is open from 8.15 to 1.0pm. This includes holidays and half terms but not{Bank {Holidays. Thursday is Pension Day. Monday and Tuesday are Child Benefit Days.Lots of people come in to get change for the {Public Telephone Box.}People pay their Telephone Bills at the{Post Office. Groceries,sweets,crisps,newspapers and magazines are sold. The{Post Office section deals with pensions,driving licences,Giro-Bank and Council rents.
